Oversight of Government Management, the Federal Workforce, and the District of Columbia Subcommittee

item.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs referred to Subcommittee on Oversight of Government Management, the Federal Workforce, and the District of Columbia.

item.name: Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.

summary.text: States that Robert Bancroft of Hayden Lake, Idaho, is entitled to overtime pay plus interest for missions flown as part of operation SNOWCAP in South America between February 10, 1992, and February 14, 1994.

bill.title: A bill for the relief of Robert Bancroft of Hayden Lake, Idaho, to permit the payment of backpay for overtime incurred in missions flown with the Drug Enforcement Agency.

item.title: A bill for the relief of Robert Bancroft of Hayden Lake, Idaho, to permit the payment of backpay for overtime incurred in missions flown with the Drug Enforcement Agency.
A bill for the relief of Robert Bancroft of Hayden Lake, Idaho, to permit the payment of backpay for overtime incurred in missions flown with the Drug Enforcement Agency.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
